medical_history.chief_complaint: Weakness, fever, edema on the lower limbs, painful ulcers on the legs, aphthae on the lower lip and buccal mucosa, and liquid bloody stool.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Clinical manifestations began in January 2021 after receiving the third dose of the IndiRab rabies vaccine, with initial symptoms including joint and muscle pain, bloating, and loose stools with mucus and blood. The patient was hospitalized on April 14, 2021, after symptoms significantly worsened, with increased painful erythematous nodes in the lower limbs, ulceration and bleeding from nodes, high temperature (37.8°C), and defecation 4–5 times a day with blood and mucous stool and tenesmus.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previously healthy; received rabies vaccine after dog bite.
